A Beginner's Cheat Sheet to Vim.

13 January 2015



Over the past month or so, I have been making the gradual switch from Sublime Text 2 to vim after reading about its supposed increase in efficency. Although I had been warned of vim's steep learning curve, I actually found the transition to be rather smooth, and I'm now feeling about as comfortable with it as I did with ST2.

One of the things that really helped me internalize vim's plethora of commands and shortcuts was making my own cheatsheet. I would suggest you do the same, but if you want to cheat (pun) and save yourself some time, you can take a look at what I've made.



You can download it in PDF format here, as well as view the LaTeX code used to make the document in this Github repository.
